page.title: 09WRITTLE, VILLAGE CLUBS
page.content: Writtle has many clubs ,in fact nearly fifty .Perhaps one of the reasons for this is that it has a lot of children. Nearly all the village children can attend and some are just for the children.Another reason for there being so many clubs is that it has many places to hold them in.There is a large community centre called Longmeads.In the summer you can have fun days where you can do many different activities.Next to the 13th century church is the modern Christian Centre where Sunday School is held. Also held there is Brownies and Guides.The more sporty clubs are held down Paradise Road where there is a large playing field.On it Writtle Minors the local football club train and play.The Scouts and Cubs hold there meetings in the ancient hut at the top of the playing field.
